website_summaries.verdict: A great modem that supports gigabit plans for a more affordable price than some other models.
pros: Supports all internet speeds up to 1,000 Mbps
Allows you to enjoy ultra HD video streaming over IP
Compatible with Xfinity from Comcast, Cox, and others
cons: A separate router is required for WiFi
Not compatible with Verizon, AT&T, or with voice-bundled services

customer_reviews.title: Great DOCSIS 3
customer_reviews.text: Great DOCSIS 3.1 modem. I upgraded from an Arris 3.0 when Cox Gigablast became available in my neighborhood. With this modem I'm getting almost full gigabit download speeds! It was cheaper than any other brand, and Amazon delivered it quickly. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: DaxxRuckus

customer_reviews.title: Was great to start, but didn't last
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for 2 months now I am rebooting almost daily to get my rated internet speeds. 20mb/.5 before reboot, 175/6 after reboot. 31 channels locked down / 4 channels locked going up. Since I can fix my issue by rebooting the router I know it's not a ISP problem. For the price and the reputation of NetGear I expected much better.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: CM1000 Either a dud or no good for X-Finity
customer_reviews.text: I wasted an entire day after having X-Finity installed only to realize that either this unit was a dud, or it simply does not work with X-Finity. It would connect for a minute, then could not hold authentication. It created all kinds of network issues and even MAC spoofing provided no solution. I plugged in a different router the next day and all my problems went away, and everything worked as it should. I really did not feel like wasting any more time with Netgear trying to troubleshoot a defective product, so, I returned it. If you look at other reviews you will see I am not alone.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Hewitt

customer_reviews.title: Doubled my speed and future proof
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this modem. Our nine year old modem Motorola SB6120 had become obsolete and wasn't allowing us to experience the full 250 Mbps Comcast plan we were paying for. Enter the NETGEAR CM1000 modem. This modem gives us a little more speed than the plan we're on. We consistently get 253 Mbps download and 12 Mbps upload. Besides that, it's a DOCIS 3.1 modem, so we're good to go if we ever wish to increase our Internet plan.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Miller

customer_reviews.title: Did not process the 1 Gig bps bandwidth
customer_reviews.text: This device could not process the 1 gig bps bandwidth as specified. After self-installation this device and accomplished the Cox Communications upgrade to 1 Gigablast service, I was frustrated with only receiving 300 Mbps downlink to this modem after a dozen times of speed testing. I finally had to pay a Cox technician to troubleshoot my setup. After a couple hours of tracing the 1 gig signal successfully, he determined to replace the modem (he used Arris TM-3402A). Finally, we saw the 915 MBPS downlink at the output of the Arris modem. All that frustration, time and cost cause by this bad modem.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Freezes constantly. Support is a joke.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Freezes constantly. After a power outage; forget it, it takes HOURS to come back or you have to reset, reinstall, etc. NETGEAR Customer Service is a COMPLETE joke; you get 90 days support from the date of purchase... this was gifted and did not get hooked up until two months later.... so wegot 30 days... after that you have to pay neck here to help you out. I was thinking that Netgear I have been a long-standing name and therefore it would’ve been good and supportive. I was wrong, it’s an old dinosaur. Do yourself a favor and purchase another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a year and 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Started to get internet disconnections about a week ago at random times. It would go offline all night and randomly connect in the middle of the day and work fine for a few hours. Called the cable company and they could not detect the modem. The LED lights would all turn off except for the Ethernet LED. Then hours later they would turn on randomly to try to connect and indicate its connected but really wasn't. This happened to me before on my previous Motorola Surfboard that lasted 5 years, which are the symptoms that the modem is dying. Didn't expect this to happen just a little over a year on a $170 modem. Will not buy Netgear modems again.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: This modem delivers the speed.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my Cable internet to gigabit and needed a gigabit Docsis 3.1 modem and this one fit the bill at a reasonable price.. Simply transferred the cables from the other modem over, registered it with the company and started it up.. it has no problems delivering the speed.. I did end up buying a cat-7 cable to go between the modem and router which seemed to help getting more reliable speed tests.. I also had to replace my router because it could not deliver the gigabit.. I got an Tp-link AC-5400 and everything is fast! Modem has no real setup required and worked out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: LV_Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great modem
customer_reviews.text: Initially bought a CM700 and it worked for a few months. Then my internet intermittently went out or was very slow and never attained half the speed I was paying for. After blaming optimum for some time and getting nowhere I did a lot of research to figure out what was happening. Turns out that the CM700 among many other modems have a defective chip. (Check badmodems.com for more on that) I decided to replace it just in case with this CM1000 and it has worked for months with no issue. No outages and I'm hitting speeds I didn't before. If you're having issues, check that site against your modem and see if it's your modem that needs replacement
customer_reviews.author: emil

customer_reviews.title: Solid Equipment;Great Investment
customer_reviews.text: This is worth every penny. When I was forced to work from home due to COVID-19 I had to ramp up my Internet bandwidth so I purchased the CM1000 cable modem. I could have saved a few bucks with other brands but I had zero margin for error so I invested in the more expensive model. Boy am I glad I did. As other people constantly complain about their cheaper models letting them down, the CM1000 hums along with all lights lit!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Bevins

customer_reviews.title: Good modem
customer_reviews.text: Plugged right in and connected to my router no problem. Works great with RCN, I pay for 500mbps down and they’ve been giving me 700mbps down consistently through this router. Very easy to install, my only beef it it’s easy to tip over which can get annoying. But for what it is it’s great. Been using it three months now with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Crazy Fast!
customer_reviews.text: The CM1000 was a no brainer to set up. Once COMCAST activated, and I resolved all of my malware issues (not a result of any purchased equipment but certainly affecting all my equipment), my 250 Mbps download plan, via a NetGear AC1600 wireless router, was routinely producing 375 to 430 Mbps download speeds with 23 to 27 Mbps uploads. Rock solid performance and NetGear quality combined with NetGear's excellent customer service is what everyone using the internet wants...for their system to work so flawlessly it's almost forgotten...it's impossible to beat. (At the cable store, when I turned their modem-router back in, the techs asked what hardware I had chosen, they were all in agreement — the CM1000 is excellent!)
customer_reviews.author: riceinwa

customer_reviews.title: Locks up Daily
customer_reviews.text: In order to keep this modem online you have to reboot it daily or sometimes more. It will randomly stop communicating. Even hitting it's ip address directly will get you no response. A reboot fixes it for a time, but the time between lockups is random and will eventually make you just toss the thing. Paying the cable company to provide a modem is cheaper than the life cycle and headaches of this thing. I will not be using them again.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this based on the reviews, guess those weren't entirely accurate. This modem lasted 36 days. Also cost me a service call from my cable provider since I was sure the "new" modem wasn't the problem, boy was I wrong. Had to hook up my old modem (purchased in 2015) while I try and contact NetGear. Modem should last longer than 36 days. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas McCloskey

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Hooked everything up the internet worked for 10 minutes and then all the lights shut off except the bottom one Stayed solid amber. Reset power multiple times. Tried different outlets. Turned modem off for 15 minutes and tried again. Same problem. Called and sat on hold for them to tell me in need to send it back for a refund and another won’t be available for another month.. big waste of time and will be without internet till Incan order a different model that’s available.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Dead in 2 years - but thats OK!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it March 2018 and died in May 2020. Worked flawlessly for all except last two months when it started intermittent loosing synch with ComCast cable. They came out inspected lines signal is great and they said probably modem bad. I tried with an older Arris SB6141 and that worked flawlessly so Netgear modem was definitely faulty. Bought an Arris SB8220 on Amazon this time. Buying a modem every two years is still cheaper than paying $14 + tax each month to ComCast to rent theirs.
customer_reviews.author: SamMo

customer_reviews.title: As usual for Amazon, a bunch of reviews for different models here.  I am reviewing the CM1000.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem after a few weeks of terrible experiences with the "approved" SB6190 on Spectrum. After calling to confirm that they would, in fact, provision this unauthorized modem on their network I bought it and set it up. Speed was increased, and the random lags and disconnections I experienced with the Puma 6 chipset in the SB6190 are gone. On day 1, it's a noticeable improvement. I will update this review if anything changes down the road. *4 months later I am happy to report that this modem is rock solid. No lags, no dropouts, consistent speed. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: David Moorhead

customer_reviews.title: 2.5 Years Troublefree!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I knew I was going to have my provider (Mediacom) for a long enough period of time to offset the cost. This modem has been trouble free the entire time I've had it. It's rarely been rebooted (and the times that it has have been related to other problems, it was just part of my troubleshooting), and provides speeds as fast at the day I bought it. Why pay $10/month for whatever modem your ISP happens to throw at you, when in just under 2 years you've paid off the difference, and never have to worry about a modem fee again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement
customer_reviews.text: Comcast emailed me and said I could have 500mbps if I upgraded to Docsis 3.1. So I did some research and decided on this Modem. I had the Arris Surfboard SB6190 which worked great for my downloads around 250mbps. Once I received this item I installed it with ease and called Xfinity. They had me downloading at 480 within minutes. Modem runs cool and quite. Very happy with its speed for both download/upload/ping. As you can see over the last 5 months in the picture I have had very consistent results!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Scriber

customer_reviews.title: Stop leasing equipment and buy this instead. Pays for itself.
customer_reviews.text: I have Comcast cable internet paired with DirecTV (because ATT internet speeds stink where I am). I bought this to increase the speed of my old modem. Opened it up switched the service over to the unit, hooked it up to my router and this thing has been humming along ever since. I don’t think I’ve ever had to reset it since I purchased it and it pays for itself before the year is over due to the outrageous fees Comcast charges. Don’t lease equipment when it’s this easy to buy it and set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away from This Device!
customer_reviews.text: I saw a couple of reviews that this device drops signal. Well it had to happen to me after my 30 days returned-period, now I have to be stuck on the phone with Netgear to claim a new device but they want to do troubleshoot and all the 9 yards. I already had 6 techs in here thinking it was my Internet provider but it resulted it's this defective modem causing all the trouble. Save the headache and get something else!!
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: THESE UNITS ARE BUGGY
customer_reviews.text: MY FINAL PROBLEM IS THIS UNIT IS JUST BAD, ONE UNIT WAS SENT BACK BECAUSE IT HAD SOMETHING ROLLING AROUND IN IT, THE OTHER UNIT JUST QUIT AFTER A YEAR, I HAVE A OLDER 700 NETGEAR THAT I REINSTALLED AND IT WORKED FINE,AND THE SUPPORT TRIED BUT IN THE END THEY JUST TRIED TO BLAME THE INTERNET SERVICE. MY FINAL COMMENT IS LOOK AROUND BEFORE YOU BUY THIS MODEM.
customer_reviews.author: Ront

customer_reviews.title: Useful signal and log information
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was having signal problems and my cable company was denying it. They lock users out of the modems that they provide for free now, so you can't see the signal strength or event logs. Once I replaced their modem and was able to review the logs, I scheduled a tech visit and showed them to the tech who then identified the issue and fixed it. It's a shame we have to do this as customers, but it is what it is. Please, make sure your cable company supports this modem with the speeds you have available before you buy it - they should have a list on their website.
customer_reviews.author: Philanon

customer_reviews.title: Failed just before 2 years
customer_reviews.text: The modem has been solid for the two years I have owned it. This last week my speeds have dropped from 1Gbps to 150Mbps... I contacted Comcast and they said my modem isn't responding to all channels and that I need to contact the Manufacturer. I tried contacting Netgear and they simply said I have no coverage and they can't help me unless I pay $89.99USD for 6-months support... Yeah NO THANK YOU! I would rather put that 89.99 towards a new modem. As a side note there has also been no firmware updates AND now there is a V2 and two newer versions since this one released. ***DO NOT BUY THE CM1000!!!***
customer_reviews.author: Luke @HuzzahGamers

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: This works with Wave internet in Redwood City. I have a wired connection at around 800MBS, so it's great. I use it with a "TP-Link WiFi 6 Router AX1800 Smart WiFi Router (Archer AX21)" to get 230MBs+ over wifi through wood and sheetrock. I give them 5 stars but, what would be really awesome is if I could switch routers and modems without having to turn it on and off again. I was on the fence about leaving a 4-star review. Anyway, seems to work. If you're in the bay area, Wave Broadband has great technicians, I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Brown

customer_reviews.title: Dead after one year.
customer_reviews.text: Died after 12 months of use. Just the amber network light stays on, even when not connected to my network. Thanks Netgear for a $160 paperweight. Also perfect timing since everyone is working remotely this day and age. Would not recommend it at all as this seems to be a known failure that Netgear won't do anything about. Going back to Motorola as I had one of their modems last over a decade.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Holy Smokes Batman
customer_reviews.text: This modem is fast! I was getting 235Mbs with my old modem and now I’m getting speeds of 600 Mbs. I am really happy with my purchase and new data speeds. I was up and running with 10 minutes from the time I got my package from the front door to testing my internet speed. I highly recommend this Netgear modem.
customer_reviews.author: GadgetGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It's a really great product. For the past 2 years I have only had to reset it once or twice. The app that comes with it has some weird red exclamation points, and from within the app I wasn't able to send a request to inquire what's going on with it. Also, I couldn't find any hint/popup info when I try to click on it. But otherwise, I had no issues with it. I am really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: rmezei

customer_reviews.title: Future proofing.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best consumer modem out there. It's not cheap and honestly it's not necessary... Yet. This is the option if you're looking to not need another modem in 10 years. 1 star off in the durability category because the stand is a tad flimsy but overall this modem is a beast. For you non-techy people out there: this modem will NOT magically make your internet faster. It can give you your ISPs full potential speeds but you're only going to get the speeds you are paying for. There is no magic pill for faster internet speeds, except cash and a willing ISP. If you're not paying for 1gbps service then a cheaper modem is probably right for you.
customer_reviews.author: datamatrix

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Giga Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: The NETGEAR CM1000 is an excellent gigabit cable modem. Setup was simple, but I encountered an issue getting top speed from my ISP. The issue was resolved and now I'm getting blazing speed. The small footprint is appreciated. The base feels flimsy, but it holds the device upright and if placed in a secure location, this is not an issue. The CM1000 ultimately delivers fast internet and that's what matters. Thank you, Netgear. Excellent job.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this on recommendation from our internet provider installation tech. Such a nightmare... very difficult to set up. Worked on and off, very inconsistent- when we finally switched back to the cheap box provided by the internet company, our service was lightening fast. This was such a waste of time...it took multiple hours on the phone with foreign text support, all for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn J

customer_reviews.title: Better than my internet providers modem.
customer_reviews.text: Too complicated for me to connect without my current internet provider's assistance, and I consider myself above average intelligence in this area. You basically have to call your internet provider and they will need to get the model and serial number specs from your modem so your internet service can communicate with your new modem. This modem was worth it because I find the modem router combo that my internet service provides is inferior to what's available. Only downside is, my internet provider is punishing me an extra $25 a month to have purchased my own modem and router, but I got to have something more efficient for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Frosty

customer_reviews.title: Good while it works but ultimately unreliable
customer_reviews.text: My first CM1000 lasted about 18 months and then started dropping connection and rebooting itself - every few weeks at first, then weekly, then daily, then finally stopped working completely. When it works it works well and can handle advertised speeds. It's a very simple and straightforward modem to install and doesn't require any significant management. When the first one broke I purchased another and I still prefer it to renting a modem, but I'm not happy about the poor durability of the device. Expect to replace it every 1.5 to 2 years and you'll be otherwise satisfied with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: THIS MODEM IS NOT CERTIFIED TO WORK WITH SPECTRUM AS ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE - Online Amazon description: COMPATIBLE WITH ALL MAJOR CABLE INTERNET PROVIDERS: Including certification by Xfinity by Comcast, COX, and Spectrum. NOT compatible with Verizon, AT&T, CenturyLink, DSL providers, DirecTV, DISH and any bundled voice service. Box the modem comes in: Not certified to work with Spectrum. If they can't get that part right, I have serious reservations about using this product. Their tech support is outsourced and horrible, the app directs you to a website that's been moved (sloppy work - someone should check the links) and the NETGEAR website leads to nowhere. It's up to you if you want to take a chance on a product run by a dishonest marketing team.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Extremely fast!
customer_reviews.text: We switched our service to the local cable company and I did not want to rent their modem for 14 dollars a month. I told the guy that I would buy my own. He was very helpful on what to buy. He informed me that the 3.0 was going to be obsolete with the new technology they are upgrading to. He said we would need the 3.1 to work with the upgrades that would be happening within upcoming months. This modem is extremely fast and connected very easily to the New WiFi system.
customer_reviews.author: Shiloh

customer_reviews.title: Stop paying rental fees
customer_reviews.text: The digital manual was conveniently located on Amazon which made set up a breeze. A simple phone call to my ISP and the modem was activated and utilizing my internet speed to its fullest capacity. I only have a 400Mbps, and the modem is rated for double that. I purchased more what what I needed to leave room for upgraded speed in the future should I choose to go that route. It has no problem running an entire home of google home Wifi routers (3).
customer_reviews.author: ajv1407

customer_reviews.title: Not for Wave Broadband
customer_reviews.text: Although the Wave Broadband website says this modem is one of two certified to work on their network, don’t buy it. Every month for 3 months I had to restart the modem to re-establish connection. Then in the fourth month it couldn’t hold an internet connection for more than 1 minute at a time. The tech support that came to my house said, “Netgear doesn’t really work with Wave. Buy an Arris instead.” Now I have a 4 month old worthless $184 brick that I can’t return.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 54 weeks, 2 weeks past warranty
customer_reviews.text: This cable modem worked fine until 2 weeks after the warranty expired, when its ability to stay powered and stay connected to internet first became erratic and then failed completely. I expect a $170 cable modem to last at least 3 years, not just 2 weeks past 1 year. I ordered an exact replacement because the Netgear CM1000 is still the best for high speed broadband with state of the art features despite being unreliable. The fact that the new purchase is working perfectly verifies that the previous purchase failed (i.e. the failures were not my ISP, not my router, not my adapters, not my computers, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: Scott A Turner

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: We started having intermittent connectivity issues across all devices and multiple routers in our home, which pointed either to our ISP or the cable modem. The old modem was about 5 years old, which is the age I've seen similar problems in the past. So I read reviews, ordered this new model, and it fixed our issues and has been running without a hitch for a month or so. There was some delay in getting it to connect properly initially, and I got on the phone to Comcast Technical Support and selected the option to have the modem reset. It took a bit longer after that, but finally connected and started working flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Jim A

customer_reviews.title: Working brilliantly with my RCN gigabit
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a customer-owned device kind of person, so I replaced my Arris Surfboard DOCSIS 3.0 with this when I moved up to a gigabit plan. I've not been disappointed. Works great with a hardware-offloaded Ubiquiti ER-X, I'm getting fantastic speeds down. RCN isn't the greatest with uploading, but that's no fault of the modem. There's nothing like downloading games from Origin at 60 MegaBYTES a second while three other people in your house are streaming media...
customer_reviews.author: Mark Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but works
customer_reviews.text: I decided to replace my ISP provided modem with this Netgear solution. I’ve had some issues with a couple of my ISP’s cheaper, older modems which they had provided. Likely some overkill for my purposes, and therefore pricey for my needs but it seems to work well so far. Pretty easy to setup, and I like that I can logon to this modem to reboot it if needed. My prior modems had stopped automatically providing an external IP address whenever I rebooted my router, forcing me to cycle power on the modem. This unit provides the IP upon router reboot. I spent more than I wanted to here, but am generally pleased with the performance so far.
customer_reviews.author: Raptor

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a Netgear router or Netgear wireless router like a Nighthawk R7000 and don't feel like renting your modem from Cox, then this is THE modem you want. This is docsis 3.1 and backwards compatible for docsis 3.0. Meaning that it'll serve the purpose of whatever type of internet service you have with Cox, this can handle it including gigablast. Basically you're future-proofing your home gear for the next few years and it'll pay for itself within 18 months compared to renting it. My wireless speeds are now up to par since moving to the same brand modern as my wireless router.
customer_reviews.author: David W

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: We have had this modem for ONLY 4 months and today it stopped working. After spending almost 2 hours on the phone with a representative who could care less with our satisfaction, they are sending a new modem. I will NEVER buy another Netgear product!
customer_reviews.author: Weebec

customer_reviews.title: Slower speeds with this modem
customer_reviews.text: Getting only 450Mbs with Xfinity Gigabit. This modem only has 256MB of memory compared to the other recommended Xfinity compatible routers which had (512GB and 1GB). The other routers also had multiple ethernet ports. Wish I had gone with another modem for $10 or $20 more. Along with this modem I purchased the Nighthawk X4S R7800, another regret due to the buggy firmware.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an older modem furnished by our cable provider (Cox). We have fast internet (Cox calls it gigablast) and this modem seems to be able to handle it well. With smart home devices, smart TV's, etc. we have 37 devices connected to our Linksys mesh network, so a good modem is critical. We don't have to pay modem rental either. Bottom line, I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Coto Pete

customer_reviews.title: Died
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this modem in September of 2018, so just over a year ago and it completely died on us yesterday. We had to have Comcast out to diagnose the issue and they said the modem was complete junk. I’m so upset that we spent so much money on this nice modem just for it to die a little after a year. I won’t be buying Netgear again!
customer_reviews.author: The Rondeau Family

customer_reviews.title: Check Box for Spectrum Customers! (V2. 0)
customer_reviews.text: Great modem on my 400Mbps Network! I had to get a replacement from a big box store as the one I ordered here would not work on my Spectrum Account, (If you look on the box it will not be compatible with Spectrum and no logo also. I went on Spectrum's List of Compatible Modem and for the CM1000 it has to be Version 2! The one I purchased locally did in fact show Spectrum's Logo right on the box. I installed and it connected to Spectrum's Network right away and great speed (See photo from SpeedTest App) It is a great High Speed Modem for over 400Mbps!
customer_reviews.author: Eric N.

customer_reviews.title: Running Gigabit like a champ
customer_reviews.text: This cable modem has been pulling over 900 MPBS on my Gigabit network connection. It has been running constantly without the need to do any rebooting or crashes. I have had a lot of modems over the years and this one exceeds them all in reliability and connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Faster Speeds
customer_reviews.text: After receiving a few messages from Comcast that it was time to upgrade my cable modem, I bought this. My old modem capped out at 130 mbps. After a very simple set up and validating my Comcast account I was back in business. Speed jumped up to 160 mbps. I bought new Cat 7 cable and the speed jumped up again to 185 mbps. Now when Comcast gets Gigbit service in my area, I'm ready.
customer_reviews.author: Roadside

customer_reviews.title: First DOA.  Second working well.  Blinking power light = dead.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to this modem after upgrading Xfinity internet to 1gbps. First modem the power light was blinking. After spending over an hour on the phone with Xfinity they pointed out that the power light should go from blinking to solid within the first few seconds. Why this took an hour to pull out of them only proves how sadistic they are over there. I called Netgear to confirm. Tech support refused to answer the simple question and instead made me run through a series of resets and reboots only at the end to confirm that the blinking power light was an issue. Ugh. Amazon's return was a breeze, new one works great. For now. Miserable customer service though.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done but some Comcast issues
customer_reviews.text: Mostly plug and play. Did not come with a coax cable which was depressing. Sleds are as expected. For Comcast, when they added the modem to the account, it stopped working properly; basically wouldn't send signal to my router. Comcast techs were clueless, but since I used to work in high speed internet, I remembered some of my old tricks and got things working. Took a full factory reset, so if that happens to you, try a factory reset of the modem. Not sure why it was needed in this case.
customer_reviews.author: Tempting Reviews

customer_reviews.title: The Docsis 3.1 modem that works.
customer_reviews.text: I have Comcast Xfinity Blast service. I purchased an Arris Surfboard SB8200 modem which I tried to use for 3 weeks. It kept locking up on me and required a hard (power cycle) reboot to reset it. I returned it to Amazon (thank you!) and purchased a Netgear CM1000 modem. It has worked solid for the past month without a single problem. The Netgear CM1000 works, that is what counts.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: New Modem already associated with another Comcast account.
customer_reviews.text: I called Comcast to replace Comcast rental modem and they told me that this modem was already associated with another account. I said how can this be as I just bought this off Amazon and paid full price? After an hour on the phone with Comcast Tier 2 support they said they could not add the modem and that I would have to take it to a Comcast store 30 minutes away. Not happy at all I did so and they told me the same thing and that they could not add modem and I should return the used item.
customer_reviews.author: gurureview

customer_reviews.title: Not shipped in a box. Arrived damaged.
customer_reviews.text: 09-02-18 - It wasn’t packed in a box. Just in its retail box as it’s own item. Beyond that once I took it out of the box I knew there was something wrong when all I could hear was metal sliding around inside of the router when I moved it around. Best guess? Heat sink fell off the board. Returned for new one. Hopefully it comes in working order and I can Ammend this review to have a higher rating. Either way the Comcast guy is here in a few days and if the next one is also bad I’m kind of screwed.
customer_reviews.author: David A Torode

customer_reviews.title: A trash modem, spent my whole afternoon
customer_reviews.text: issue for stable connection , it keep drop packets every few minutes. I spend my whole afternoon to figure out. It is caused by the new modem. I am an expert tech person. First time experienced with a poor quality modem. and I decided to try motorola mb8600. hope I am lucky this time. No idea why a modem could be made with a poor quality. Damn, why I can not leave my comment?
customer_reviews.author: Good day

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Had to upgrade from a previous one in the same Netgear series, as it was rated up to only 500Mbits and my new service supports 1Gbit. I made sure to verify that this model did indeed work with Comcast. As usual the swap was easy as you simply phone tech support and tell them that you have a new modem. Once they get the make, model, serial and MAC address you're good to go. I have had zero issues thus far. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M. Loomis

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work with Comcast gigabit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem (CM1000) to work with Comcast gigabit internet. It works, but at about 30-80Mbps. I've been running speed tests for a week, and 90 was the highest I got. I had Comcast support update the firmware, check the device, and no luck. As an experiment, I swapped the modem out for my old Arris Surfboard DOCSIS 3.0 modem, and immediately got 3x-5x faster speeds (still slower than gigabit, but better than this modem). I've never had good luck with Netgear products, and this is no better.
customer_reviews.author: H. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: NOT COMPATIBLE WITH XFINITY (despite what the box says)
customer_reviews.text: Don't fall for the big claims on the box as being compatible with xFinity. IT'S NOT COMPATIBLE WITH XFINITY. Trust me, I went through 3 tiers of xFinity support over the course of 90 minutes before someone finally told me that this modem is NOT supported. Apparently it has some kind of signaling issue on NetGear's side of things, which has not been corrected, so xFinity has no choice but to not support it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendell

customer_reviews.title: Leaking signal and unusable after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in an effort to avoid rental fees with the internet company. Unfortunately, our internet signal has been spotty and blips in and out daily since the beginning. I ignored the issue for a while as resetting the modem generally got our signal back. However I finally broke down and called the cable company to address the issue and their evaluation shows the signal is leaking from the modem. Making the modem pretty much unusable. So 180 dollars paid for six months of modem usage. What a waste of many. Would have been better off renting from the internet company and having functional internet and signal for the last few months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Basic product works great
customer_reviews.text: Product works as advertised but both times I called in for tech support I was given erroneous answers to my connection speed problem. Each tech blamed my WiFi provider. Turns out it was in my laptop. One biggie is I cannot connect my wired printer to the network; the router will not recognize it when connected. I have to use it on a laptop. Will update my review after trying tech support again. Also a couple of times after a power loss I had to manually restart the modem so it would reconnect to my router. Signal strength though is excellent through out a 1/4 acre property and a 2 story home.
customer_reviews.author: Pro tools

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This item stopped working for me after 2 months. Don't buy it. The unit stopped working in two months. See other people's reviews. About 10% of the users have this issue. It stopped connecting to the ISP suddenly after 2 months (very conveniently outside of the replacement window). What's worse was Netgear's support. They insist on giving a used device, no refund, no new device. Very rude and unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Li

customer_reviews.title: Better than the service provider supplied unit
customer_reviews.text: Definitely improved download speed from the Xfinity supplied unit, paired with an asus AC5300 router this makes an outstanding home network. Purchased with 4 year replacement warranty for piece of mind. Once activated on the account it was immediately noticeable speed increase. Upload remains the same but I suspect that's due to my service area not hardware
customer_reviews.author: Lance Thebodeau

customer_reviews.title: Pooped the bed after 15 months
customer_reviews.text: Paired this with a Nighthawk wireless router. ISP started reporting the modem was reporting bad telemetry, and download speeds were 1 third of what I should have been receiving. Started seeing random connection drops once a week, then 3 times a day. This was 15 months after purchase. Out of warranty now. Seems like a lot of money to spend on 15 months of service. Looking for a different manufacturer now.
customer_reviews.author: SneakyDave

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth
customer_reviews.text: Very smooth By Ken 12345 Modem install was very smooth and joined up with Obit system router with no problems. Spectrum for some unknown reason after I notified them of my new modem put me in slow speed after 36 hours of 475 mbps. I had to wait 4 days before a tech home visit admitted their error. Netgear products are the best but the rest of the world is a step behind.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R Nunn

customer_reviews.title: Comcast Cable Modem - Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this as an upgrade to my TP-Link since I was moving to a Gigabit and wanted/needed more download streams. So far after a year, I have had no issue with this modem and still runs great. Initial call to Comcast to add it and has been hands free. On the other side of the modem, I run a WIFI router and have over 30+ devices on my network. Play on 4 PS4 or 3 PC's at the same time while grandkids watch Netflix and have almost no lag anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Lane

customer_reviews.title: Fast while it last...which apparently isn’t for long.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 13 months ago and it stopped sending the internet connection to my router. The lights all come on and even after resetting it, no internet! It is amazing how fast those who claim they love you can turn on you when you deny them internet. I replaced this with the Arris modem and I am loved again. I would recommend just staying away from Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Coty

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Modem for Altice / Optimum
customer_reviews.text: Excellent modem working smoothly for Optimum / Altice service. I have it running at 500 MBS without a hitch for over a week now and returned the modem Optimum supplied and was charging for it $10+ per month.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away!
customer_reviews.text: Tech support is only available for the first 90 days. After that, Netgear wants you to pay for support and won't talk to you otherwise. What a joke!!
customer_reviews.author: Lue

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted for three and half months
customer_reviews.text: This modem is really good only when it works. I have owned Netgear CM100 for only three and half months and then it stopped working. Actually it started to be shaky more than one month before it completely off work. I should have taken that as a warning sign but I just thought it was the problem of Xfinity. Anyway, it seems like I have to find another modem that offers fast speed and also can work for a long time. Any recommendations?
customer_reviews.author: Jane Zhu

customer_reviews.title: Please read this from Netgeart
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for providing your proof of purchase. I have updated your product registration however, your [receipt/order confirmation/invoice] shows that your NETGEAR Ultra-High Speed Cable Modem CM1000 is sold by Amazon Electronic Depot, which is not an authorized NETGEAR reseller. Due to your product being purchased from an unauthorized reseller, your product is not eligible for warranty coverage, as stated in our Consumer Warranty Information: “Your NETGEAR product must have been purchased from an authorized NETGEAR reseller in order to be eligible for warranty coverage.”
customer_reviews.author: Larry M

customer_reviews.title: Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Have always liked Netgear products. Bought this to replace my Motorola 8x4 modem. Hooked up my netgear 32x8 channel modem and on Xfinity my downloads speeds shot up from 110 mbps to 180 mbps immediately! Was super easy to set up out of the box. Gave it 4 stars on durability because I've only had it for a week. But all my previous netgear products have held up well. Definitely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jack C. Sr.

customer_reviews.title: I picked up another 15 meg download speed!
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea what the deal is, but changing out the old router and going to this one netted me an additional 15 meg in download speed. It was 165 and is now 180. Beyond that, we will wait and see how it works. It does seem to run really hot, so I hope it doesn't have a meltdown in a year or so. I may have to mount some type of cheapie fan to keep the air flowing through it as the room it is in doesn't get a lot of circulation.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: this is NOT a router, JUST a modem
customer_reviews.text: Bought this expecting it to have the standard netgear router interface and such for setting things up but there was absolutely no options except reboot modem. I did some research and realized that this is a modem only (no dhcp or port forwarding, or anything like that). I was able to buy a router that has great firewall and stuff and hang it BEHIND this modem, but that was an extra I wasn't expecting. Overall the modem appears to perform ok but I'm still giving it 3 stars for not being more clear on what it actually is.
customer_reviews.author: MrAnderson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have a CM1000 for over a year now it is paired with a R6700V2 wireless router. The combination works very well with the cable access, The only problems are with the cable company. I average 8 connections on the router with two being wireless. The wireless is almost as fast as the wired on average throughout the house. I thought about upgrading to a CM1100 or CM1200 and could not see any advantage in doing so at this time. I would recommend if buying a new router go for the AX versions they are will worth the cost. pair them up with a cm1000 and 1GB internet service.e of the best I have ever used works great with Comcast/Xfinity.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: First time I bought a modem from Amazon that doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem to upgrade from the previous modem that I also bought from Amazon. The problem with this new modem is that it doesn't work. You can't find the network connection on my computer screen. I have Mediacom as a network carrier and he tried talking to the modem as they usually do and there was no sign of life. I will be trying a different Amazon seller for my upgraded modem.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Drops The Signal A Lot
customer_reviews.text: I called Spectrum to find out why I was having problems, the tech told me that this modem dropped the signal 4 times in the last 24 hours (2 is too many). I plugged back in my CM500, no drop outs. After spending over 2 hours with a Netgear 'tech' from the Philippines (no US support), they finally agreed to a RMA. I missed the Amazon return window by 10 days!!! Damn!!! Avoid this modem unless your need a $180 paper weight. I'm convinced that the only people would gave this a good review haven't checked their drop out rates?
customer_reviews.author: Bill C

customer_reviews.title: Runs very hot; longevity in question.
customer_reviews.text: This modem is 104 degree on top and 95-100 on the side of the unit. My last Netgear modem/router only lasted 2 years. I'm guessing this will also only last 1 to 2 years also because of the high heat. Netgear only sells a one year extension, so even the company doesn't have any confidence in the product lasting over 2 years. My previous modems lasted at least 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: consumer

customer_reviews.title: 31/4 channels getting bonded, activation little tricky with Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: Even though I don't have Xfinity Gigabit service, I decided to replace my old Arris SB6183 with this. The modem works fine, I am seeing 31 of the 32 downstream channels getting bonded, but only 4 of the 8 upstream are getting bonded (Here in the SF Bay area). The modem didn't activate by just following steps on xfinity.com/activate. I had to call customer service (very important for you to remember your account number otherwise they wont entertain you). It took at least 20 minutes on the call, and the technician wasn't successful, and scheduled me for a call with (probably advanced) technician. However, on a modem reboot it started working.
customer_reviews.author: Inderjeet Singh

customer_reviews.title: Mild Extortion
customer_reviews.text: This is insane - stopped working after 14 months. They wanted to charge me more money to help fix it over the phone. Would not continue to help over the phone unless I paid them more.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew F. Stahl

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Getting this thing hooked up and running in my network was way too hard. To get every device to run required completely resetting every device back to factory defaults including my Netgear R7000 wireless router. Why this needed to happen for a cable modem is beyond me but it literally wouldn't alow me to send internet to more than one device until I did that. Once I got over that hurdle it seems to be working well. Gigabit speeds with Xfinity. Well see how it lasts on the long haul.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Dugan

customer_reviews.title: Multiple disconnect on Comcast Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: As the subject stated, my Comcast Xfinity is working fine with Comcast’s own modem. The moment I swapped it with the Netgear modem, I have multiple disconnect throughout the day. Put the Comcast’s own modem back and no disconnect.
customer_reviews.author: Striders

customer_reviews.title: Mediacom works with it.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best modem I have purchased to work with Mediacom. It doesn't have 40 led bulbs flashing like a strobe light at level 900 lumens all the time. It has like 4 low light dim green LEDs that stay on. Perfect. It doesn't get hot or die. I love this thing. Highly recommended as an alternative to Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Wilson

customer_reviews.title: GLAD I PURCHASED
customer_reviews.text: For years I have rented the modem from Comcast and threw away $15 a month at a time... I purchased this a few months ago and wish i had done it sooner... no issues with instillation, service, speeds, anything since the switch... actually getting faster pings now.. I highly recommend this unit, especially if you are currently renting one
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Good but quality issues
customer_reviews.text: I have spectrum, and was happy to see this one was finally approved on their network. Nothing special, modem is modem, but I had to get 3 of them, before it finally worked reliably. First one I got from amazon, signal was good, but LAN port did not work. Second one I got from Best Buy, LAN working, but signal was failing too much that I couldn't get reliable constant speed. My 3rd unit I got from Costco, finally working as intended. On a note Costco sells 1100 unit, it's basically same thing, but has one additional LAN port.
customer_reviews.author: Vidis

customer_reviews.title: Look No Further for a Gigabit Modem
customer_reviews.text: I am using this DOCSIS 3.1 modem to access Comcast's 1 Gig service. This is one of the few modems certified by Comcast to work with that service. Set up was easy and worked first time. The modem seems very stable and delivers super high download speeds. No noise, no excess heat, and the lights are not obnoxiously bright. I have paired this with top Netgear wireless routers such as the Nighthawk X8, X10, and XR500 and it works fine with all those.
customer_reviews.author: TWM

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR Cable Modem CM1000 R7800 Not Ready for Prime Time YMMV
customer_reviews.text: Used on Comcast ISP, consistently needed modem reboots to acquire internet signal and Mbps were very inconsistent. I really wanted this to work since it was my first DOCSIS 3.1 modem. Netgear makes reliable network gear (Routers & Arlo) and this is the first time I decided to try their modem product.
customer_reviews.author: Guy2You

customer_reviews.title: Top Modem For High-Speed Internet
customer_reviews.text: This modem performed perfectly from the first power on! Although I've only had this modem for several weeks, I simply can't say enough about it's performance. Easy to install and operates smoothly without any hiccups. I can confidently recommend the CM1000 if you're in the market for a modem to handle high-speed internet.
customer_reviews.author: ch&cc

customer_reviews.title: AMAZON SENT A 2 YEAR OLD MODEM FOR A PURCHASE IN AUGUST 2020
customer_reviews.text: I have been having issues with my NETGEAR MODEM AND NIGHTGEAR ROUTER - after nearly a month of trying to resolve poor connectivity issues - I just found out from NETGEAR that the NEW CM1000 was built in 2018. HUGELY DISAPPOINTING. BUYER BEWARE - DO NOT BUY NETGEAR FROM AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Cornwell

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!!  Doubled my speed!
customer_reviews.text: Just got mine set up after having to call Comcast to register it which took about 30 minutes. Went to speedtest.net on my phone a saw that my speed doubled! I'm pretty excited about that. I just hope it holds up. My old router was a Motorola Surfboard SB6121.
customer_reviews.author: y2says

customer_reviews.title: Signal drops at certain time every day
customer_reviews.text: Our Internet provider suggested this so and we bought it based on their suggestion. Yet every day from 9:20 - 11:30 the signal drops. Our ISP says it is not on their end. Therefore we are stuck with not having Internet between those hours as paid way too much for this items to replace it within a few months of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Abbytha

customer_reviews.title: New and improved....for us.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. We bought this modem to replace our previous Net Gear 3.0 Modem Router combo. After 2 years of constant use, it started to drop signals. We decided to up grade our Modem and to buy a separate router this time instead of a combo unit. It was a bit tricky to set up, so I ended up calling our cable company's tech help desk. They were great assisting me with the installation and now we have a great signal, without interruptions or buffering.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaddiction

customer_reviews.title: It just works, no fuss, no muss
customer_reviews.text: This either connects directly to one system or to a wifi router. With my ASUS AC router the bit rate is over 800Mbs wired (service is 1Gbs). The modem does not provide wifi so that rating is N/A. The Comcast tech connected it, but I suspect self setup would be simple. It sits next to the cable entrance and does the job quietly, there has been no need to reset or cycle the power.
customer_reviews.author: RobertTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup with Xfinity. A phone call to support kicked of the install and registration. This was a replacement for a 5 year old disco router that kept dropping signal. We have not dropped signal since Wifi is not included with this router but preexisting Google wifi connected perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Rick S

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a ARRIS 500Mbps modem that died after 9 months with this Netgear modem and so far it is working great! Easy to install and runs a lot cooler than the ARRIS modem. My internet service is set at 300Mbps so I can not comment on the 1Gbps feature. Wish I could run it at 1Gbps but Cox cable in my area does not offer 1Gbps service. If you have a choice, and I do not, use some other internet cable service company.
customer_reviews.author: skider

customer_reviews.title: Great modem
customer_reviews.text: Modem is really easy to install the instructions should be fairly easy for anyone to follow. I did have to call my cable provider (spark light used to be cable one) to get it working. After that it’s worked flawlessly. Stable speeds and what not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Cox in AZ
customer_reviews.text: Great modem. We have Cox in Arizona and it is compatible and I was able to self install very fast internet on the existing system with this modem without having to pay modem rental fees to Cox. Our speeds on wired connections are nearly 300 Mpbs, which is what our internet plan max is. NO issues whatsoever, plug and play for us.
customer_reviews.author: John and Krystina

customer_reviews.title: Worth it to get a good modem
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the CM1000 to go with Wave gigabit service. Easy setup, good documentation and great performance. No troubles with the modem, I did have one call in to Netgear for an issue with a new router purchased at the same time that was resolved quickly which is why I gave 5 stars for support.
customer_reviews.author: Trippin' Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet cable and wifi not working simultaneously
customer_reviews.text: I was able to activate it online easily without calling the internet provider but the ethernet and wifi not working simultaneously. If wifi is working, ethernet won't and vice versa. It wasted my half day figuring it out. Called the netgear customer service and still did not solved my problem. Have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: pinoyeagle

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait until I used this for awhile before I wrote a review. Had it about 3 months now and it's working great. I have found Netgear to be a very solid brand and decided to get this modem to work with my Netgear Router. They work seamlessly together. Nice design that looks nice in my home office. I will stick with Netgear for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Renaissance Woman

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 9 months.
customer_reviews.text: Spent $180 on this modem. It stopped working after 9 months. For that, I could have rented a modem from my provider for a year and a half.
customer_reviews.author: DesertMom

product_meta.title: NETGEAR Cable Modem CM1000 - Compatible with all Cable Providers including Xfinity by Comcast, Spectrum, Cox | For Cable Plans Up to 1 Gigabit | DOCSIS 3.1, Black (CM1000-1AZNAS)
product_meta.description: Style:1000Mbps Max Download| Pattern Name:SingleThe Net gear CM1000-1AZNAS ultra-high speed Cable Modem provides a connection to high-speed cable Internet with speeds up to 6 Gbps. It is the industry's first DOCSIS 3. 1 cable labs Certified cable modem, 10x faster than DOCSIS 3. 0. Working with both DOCSIS 3. 0 and DOCSIS 3. 1 cable Internet service providers, it is the ultra-high speed Cable Modem ready for today's service plans and future upgrades. Enjoy Ultra HD video streaming over IP with 2x2 OFDM or 32x8 channel bonding giving you the fastest download speeds—even during peak hours. Save up to 120 a year* by eliminating Internet service provider rental fees. Ideal for Internet service plan 300Mbps and above. Certified with Comcast XFINITY, Cox and Mediacom. Please check your cable Internet service provider web site for data speed tier compatibility and to ensure it provides DOCSIS 3.1 service, otherwise this modem will only work as a DOCSIS 3.0 modem - Microsoft Windows 7, 8, 10, Vista, XP, 2000, Mac OS, or other operating systems running a TCP/IP network - Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0, Firefox 2.0Safari 1.4, or Google Chrome 11.0 browsers or higher.
feature_bullets: Compatible with all major cable internet providers: Including certification by Xfinity by Comcast, COX, and Spectrum. NOT compatible with Verizon, AT&T, CenturyLink, DSL providers, DirecTV, DISH and any bundled voice service.
Save monthly rental fees: Model CM1000 replaces your cable modem saving you up to $168/yr in equipment rental fees.
Built for ultimate speed: best for cable provider plans up to 1 gigabit speed.
Works with any wifi router: Connect any WiFi router to this modem's ethernet port to support all your wireless devices.
Ethernet connections: 1 Gigabit Ethernet port connects to your computer or separate WiFi router.
Modem technology: Engineered with 32x8 channel bonding, OFDM 2x2, and DOCSIS 3.1.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars16,540 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
